comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Planned to cross the Atlantic in his motor lifeboat with his new bride, Signe Holm Sivard, July 1914.  He was a naval architect.  (They also traveled with a navigator, a wireless operator, and other crew members.)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Starting their voyage on July 25, 1914, hey made it all the way from New York to Boston, when the attempted Atlantic crossing had to be aborted, upon receipt of news that World War I had broken out in Europe.
